  2. HTTP Servers

    There are different kinds of HTTP servers for different purposes. Mainly, it has two types of HTTP servers:
    1). Server serving static HTML, CS, JS, image and other files. e.g. Apache HTTP server. This kind of server is also called Web Server, HTTP Server.
    2). Server passing HTTP requests to applications to dynamically generate web contents. e.g. Tomcat, Glassfish, Kestrel. This kind of server is also called Web container, Application server.

    Other kinds of server including (reverse) proxy server/load balancer, such as Nginx.

    There is no clear distinction of a specific server being a specific type. For example, the Kestrel is mainly used as a web container for ASP.NET Core web applications, but it can also be used to serving static file.

    Web container

    A web application is a program that runs inside a web container. In Java's jargon, a web application is called a servlet.

    1. Managing the lifecycle of servlets
    2. Receiving http requests and create corresponding http request objects, e.g. HttpContext, that can be understood by applications.
